intro: Banara ekmaniana, commonly known as the Malabar blackwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, heavy wood that is highly valued in traditional craftsmanship. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are elliptical in shape and glossy in appearance. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by black, spherical berries. Banara ekmaniana is often found in moist, tropical forests and is known for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
